sn55.44:1.1: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who has four things is said to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.
sn55.44:2.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.44:2.6: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.44:2.7: A noble disciple who has these four things is said to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.”
